item.title: Beogram 4000: Adjusting the AC Motor Voltage
item.description:
During my Beogram 4000 turntable restoration, I observed a noisy motor, especially at 45 RPM. Replacing the electrolytic capacitors helped but didn’t solve the problem completely. To investigate further, I examined the motor voltage and the signal waveform from the Wien bridge oscillator, a clever design that uses an incandescent light bulb as a variable resistor for amplitude control. I measured the AC waveform amplitude at one of the motor leads relative to ground...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/beogram-4000-adjusting-the-ac-motor-voltage/
